intro: Iris tenax, commonly known as the rigid iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It features tall, slender stems that bear striking blue to violet flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Iris tenax thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for gardens. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to the landscape.
